name: Death of Hugo Grotius
obverse: Bust of Hugo Grotius three-quarters right.
reverse: Book chest on which sits two crowns; to right, in the distance, Castle Loevestein; above, clouds.
description: Hugo Grotius (10 April 1583 – 28 August 1645) was a Dutch jurist.
He laid the foundations for international law, based on natural law.
A teenage intellectual prodigy, he was imprisoned for his involvement in the intra-Calvinist disputes of the Dutch Republic.
He escaped hidden in a chest of books. He wrote most of his major works in exile in France.
